items.name: Fortnite Launch Arguments Guide
items.description:
[Focus: FPS] Shows a reference of useful Fortnite launch arguments and what they do, so you can copy/paste only what you actually need. Common performance-focused arguments:
- -USEALLAVAILABLECORES → Lets Fortnite use all logical CPU cores (usually default now, but can help on some systems).
- -NOSPLASH → Skips the splash screen for slightly faster start.
- -noforcemaccel → Tries to disable mouse acceleration in some setups.
- -noasynccompute → Disables async compute; sometimes smoother on problematic GPUs.
- -d3d11 → Forces DirectX 11.
- -d3d12 → Forces DirectX 12 (can give higher FPS but may stutter on some rigs).
- -vulkan → Forces Vulkan (only if officially supported in your build).
- -limitclientticks → May reduce micro-stutter on some systems by capping client ticks.
- -refresh=X → Ask the game to run at X Hz (e.g. -refresh=240). Monitor + driver must support it.
- -FrameRateLimit=XXX → Set custom FPS cap (e.g. -FrameRateLimit=237.000000). Stability & troubleshooting arguments:
- -nothreading → Force single-threaded mode (rarely useful, only for specific crashes).
- -log → Enable extra logging for debugging issues.
- -dx11 → Same as -d3d11 (legacy alias on some builds). Notes:
- Epic updates the engine often; some older flags may be ignored in new builds.
- Always test arguments one-by-one or in small groups instead of spamming everything at once.
- If FPS or stability gets worse, remove the last argument(s) you added.
- Never trust random TikTok lists of launch options that claim +300 FPS; many are placebo or outdated.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Open this item to read the full Fortnite launch argument guide in the description.
"@

items.name: Fortnite Config Folder (WindowsClient)
items.description: [Focus: FPS] Opens %LOCALAPPDATA%\FortniteGame\Saved\Config\WindowsClient so you can edit GameUserSettings.ini and Engine.ini for fine-tuned competitive settings.

items.name: Valorant Competitive Settings Guide
items.description:
[Focus: FPS / Latency] High-level checklist for Valorant performance:
- In-game: Fullscreen, low to medium graphics, limit FPS to a stable number below your monitor max.
- Disable V-Sync, reduce anti-aliasing, keep textures low/medium depending on VRAM.
- Turn off in-game FPS-hungry overlays (e.g. NVIDIA Ansel, ReShade, etc.).
- Make sure Riot Vanguard + Valorant are installed on SSD.
- Prefer GameUserSettings-like changes only from Riot-approved guides; avoid shady config packs.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Read the Valorant guide in the description.
"@

items.name: Overwatch 2 Performance Checklist
items.description:
[Focus: FPS] Suggestions:
- Fullscreen, high refresh rate, capped FPS slightly below monitor max.
- Low shadows, low effects, low AA; textures medium if VRAM allows.
- Disable Dynamic Render Scale if it causes stutter; or lock it to a stable target.
- Make sure the game is on SSD and shaders are fully compiled after major patches.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Read Overwatch performance tips in the description.
"@

items.name: Call of Duty / Warzone Performance Guide
items.description:
[Focus: FPS / VRAM] High-level tips (Modern Warfare / Warzone style):
- Use Fullscreen Exclusive, not Borderless.
- Cap FPS slightly below your max to reduce input spikes.
- Turn off Motion Blur, Depth of Field, Film Grain, and other post-processing.
- Keep Textures at a level that fits your GPU VRAM (check the in-game VRAM meter).
- Turn on NVIDIA Reflex / Low Latency Mode if available.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Read the Call of Duty / Warzone performance guide in the description.
"@

items.name: Rocket League Performance & Latency
items.description:
[Focus: FPS / Input] Suggestions:
- Fullscreen, uncapped FPS (or high cap) if your CPU/GPU are strong.
- Turn off Motion Blur and reduce World Detail if GPU-bound.
- Use a stable FPS cap + V-Sync off on high-refresh monitors.
- Disable Steam/Epic overlays and external FPS counters if they cause stutters.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Read the Rocket League performance tips in the description.
"@

items.name: GTA V / GTA Online Performance Checklist
items.description:
[Focus: FPS] Suggestions for GTA V / GTA Online:
- Use Fullscreen, and keep population density / variety in the mid range.
- Lower Grass / Shadows / Reflection quality if GPU-bound.
- Keep Extended Distance Scaling low unless you have a very strong GPU.
- Install the game on SSD to reduce streaming stutter in dense areas.

items.name: Apply: QoS: Prioritize Fortnite (DSCP 46 UDP/TCP)
items.description:
[Focus: Ping / Network, Latency / Input Delay]
Sets a QoS UDP/TCP policy which prioritizes Fortnite's network traffic by tagging packets with DSCP 46 (Expedited Forwarding). This helps your router process the game's packets first, which can stabilize ping and reduce packet loss on congested networks. Notes:
- Policy is created in the ActiveStore and is fully reversible from Falcon Optimizer.
- Works best if your router respects DSCP tags and your ISP does not strip them.
- If you see any weird network behavior, simply toggle this off to remove the policy.

steps.command: powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "New-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Fortnite DSCP46' -AppPathNameMatchCondition '*FortniteClient-Win64-Shipping.exe' -DSCPAction 46 -PolicyStore ActiveStore -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"
powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "Remove-NetQosPolicy -Name 'Falcon Fortnite DSCP46' -PolicyStore ActiveStore -Confirm:$false -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue"

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'SetNormalPriorityNow'

items.name: Apply: Apply competitive config baseline (game-specific files) [Real]
items.description: Creates/patches the game's config file(s) with a low-latency baseline and backs up originals for restore.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'ApplyConfigBaseline'
& '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'RestoreConfigBaseline'

items.description: Creates/patches the game's config file(s) with a low-latency baseline and backs up originals for restore.
items.name: Revert: Apply competitive config baseline (game-specific files) [Real]

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'RestoreConfigBaseline'

items.name: Clear caches used by this game (best-effort) [Real]
items.description: Deletes common cache folders for this title (where applicable).

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'ClearCaches'

items.name: Close common overlay/recording apps (manual) [Real]
items.description: Closes overlays/recording apps to reduce stutter. Manual; not auto-restored.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'CloseOverlays'

items.name: Competitive Prep (one-click) [Real]
items.description: Runs a one-click sequence: closes overlays, enables DSCP QoS, sets GPU pref, disables FSO/DPI scaling, starts 0.5ms timer, and applies the game-specific config baseline.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'CloseOverlays'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableLauncherQoS'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableQoS'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'SetGpuPref'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableFSO'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableDPI'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'StartTimer500us'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'ApplyConfigBaseline'

items.name: Competitive Restore (one-click) [Real]
items.description: Restores the game baseline backup (if present), stops the timer helper, removes GPU preference, re-enables FSO/DPI defaults, and removes QoS policies.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'RestoreConfigBaseline'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'StopTimer'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'RemoveGpuPref'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableFSO'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableDPI'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableQoS'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableLauncherQoS'

items.name: Network Only (DSCP for game + launcher) [Real]
items.description: Enables DSCP 46 QoS for both the game executable and its launcher/client.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableLauncherQoS'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'EnableQoS'

items.name: Presentation Only (GPU pref + FSO/DPI flags) [Real]
items.description: Applies only presentation-path changes: GPU preference + disable FSO + DPI flag. Does not touch network or timer.

steps.command: & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'SetGpuPref'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableFSO'; & '.\\scripts\\games\\falcon-gamepack.ps1' -Game 'fortnite' -Action 'DisableDPI'
